thread.title: Flint Water Tests Show Safe Lead Levels, NRDC Report Says

author: Kris Maher
title: Flint Water Tests Show Safe Lead Levels, NRDC Report Says
text:
The amount of lead in the drinking water of Flint, Mich., has fallen again, according to a study released Friday, as the city works to replace old pipes and takes other measures to ensure the cityâ€™s water quality is safe.
The Natural Resources Defense Council released a report Friday that found lead levels well below the federal action level of 15 parts per billion in a sample of 92 homes. A researcher at Michigan State University found a lead level of 4 ppb at the homes tested.
...
